title: Zé Luiz (footballer, born 1974)
text:
José Luiz Seabra Filho (born 25 January 1974 in <a href="Bauru">Bauru</a>, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>), simply known as Zé Luiz, is a naturalized from <a href="Trinidad%20and%20Tobago">Trinidad and Tobago</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Career.
Zé Luiz signed for <a href="W%20Connection">W Connection</a> in 2000. His previous clubs include <a href="Esporte%20Clube%20Noroeste">Noroeste</a> and <a href="Botafogo%20Futebol%20Clube%20%28SP%29">Botafogo-SP</a>.
International career.
He made his debut for the <a href="Trinidad%20and%20Tobago%20national%20football%20team">Trinidad and Tobago national team</a> in January 2005 in a friendly against <a href="Azerbaijan%20national%20football%20team">Azerbaijan</a>. However, he was unable to feature for Trinidad and Tobago at the <a href="2006%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2006 World Cup</a> because he did not gain full citizenship in time.
